intro: Stigmaphyllon nigrescens, commonly known as the black stigmaphyllon, is a member of the Malvaceae family and is native to the Atlantic Forest of Brazil. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows in moist, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its dark green, leathery leaves and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its fruits are capsule-like structures that release tiny seeds when mature. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
